summary: chelsea have made an offer for fc tokyo 's 22-year-old forward yoshinori muto . the japan international will join chelsea 's vitesse arnhem on loan next season if he completes a move to stamford bridge this summer . ogane claims that chelsea 's interest in muto is not connected to the # 200million deal they signed with japanese company yokohama rubber in february .

aspect: Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.
Muto would be the first Japanese player to represent Chelsea if he moves to west London.
Chelsea are considering a two-week pre-season tour of Japan this summer.
explain: Chelsea have made an offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.
The aspect states that Yoshinori Muto, the 22-year-old forward from FC Tokyo, is a potential first Japanese player to represent Chelsea if he moves to West London.

One core idea of this aspect is that Chelsea, an English professional football club based in Fulham, London, are planning to go on a pre-season tour of Japan this summer. The tour is expected to last for two weeks and is being considered by the club's management as a way to build relationships with their Japanese partners and explore new markets for their brand. This idea is mentioned in the given summary as a separate piece of information that is not directly related to the club's interest in FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto.
